desc: The act of going from one place to another.
example: I love to travel to new countries.

desc: An aircraft with wings used for flying.
example: We took a plane to Paris.

desc: A form of transportation that runs on tracks.
example: He goes to work by train every day.

desc: A large vehicle used to carry passengers.
example: The school bus arrives at 8 a.m.

desc: A place where you can stay overnight when traveling.
example: We stayed at a five-star hotel.

desc: Bags and suitcases used for travel.
example: Her luggage was too heavy to carry.

desc: An official document for international travel.
example: Don't forget your passport before the flight.

desc: The act of reserving something in advance.
example: We made a booking at a seaside resort.

desc: A person who is visiting a place for pleasure.
example: The city is full of tourists in summer.

desc: A short trip for leisure or education.
example: We went on an excursion to the mountains.
